Articles.Content:
Has anything been said about this, or do you think it will be implemented in some form?

In KSP1 it made sense to have immortal kerbals, but if KSP journeys are going to take very long periods of time it might make more sense to have a kerbal life expectancy. Maybe there could be a hall of fame for kerbals who achieved milestones/great amounts of flighttime/number of missions, ect

Personally i like them not aging. But thats just my $0.02 lol. IF they add it, toggle option please.

 

040110152020

Imho, would be an option in a general Kerbal health mod.

Edited October 15, 2020 by kerbiloid

9 hours ago, nsgallup said:

Has anything been said about this, or do you think it will be implemented in some form?

In KSP1 it made sense to have immortal kerbals, but if KSP journeys are going to take very long periods of time it might make more sense to have a kerbal life expectancy. Maybe there could be a hall of fame for kerbals who achieved milestones/great amounts of flighttime/number of missions, ect

If you get my Jeb Kerman killed, we WILL have problems, really big problems. If you get any of the big 4 killed, we shall have problems. I love defaulting my big 4 to the best missions, and if they are dead, I can't.
I've headcannoned that they actually live for thousands of years, so 50 years stuck in space is only a moderate setback for one of them

I hope that they're immortal, though a toggle could be cool.

Me too, @Tw1. My headcanon is that Kerbals have a sort of stasis state, and a regenerative state, so they can avoid long waits and heal after pancaking on the ground in a fighter and having only the cockpit survive.
Interesting  idea, could add some extra dimensions to mission planning.  I doubt it will become a feature though, but definitely  needs a toggle if so.

On 10/15/2020 at 4:59 AM, Mikenike said:

If you get my Jeb Kerman killed, we WILL have problems, really big problems. If you get any of the big 4 killed, we shall have problems. I love defaulting my big 4 to the best missions, and if they are dead, I can't.

FROM ME TOO!!!! I LOVE MY JEBBIE, VAL, BOBBY, AND BILLIE!!! THEY ARE THE BEST KERBALS IN THE GAME (ESPECIALLY FOR TOP MISSIONS) AND IF THEY ARE DEAD WE SHALT HAVE PLENTY OF PROBLEMS! 

Edited October 19, 2020 by Vanamonde
Don't get carried away with font sizes, please.

On 10/15/2020 at 1:23 PM, DAFATRONALDO2007 IN SPACE said:

 

BIG FONT MUCH???? But yeah, I agree.

Edited October 19, 2020 by Vanamonde

If cryogenic pods are introduced to stock then aging would fit in stock.  Otherwise, they are little green immortal frankenhobbits.  A mod that only added cryogenic pods and aging is probably the most likely approach
As a species, the kerbals will have to die of natural causes at some point. I just figured that they are a long lived species with a slow reproduction cycle. That's my head cannon anyways.
I DO NOT WANNA SEE A LIFE EXPECTANCY FOR ANY OF THE ORIGINAL FOUR... THE OTHER KERBALS, HOWEVER, CAN DIE AS SOON AS THEY NEED TO...
My mod adds a lifespan to Kerbals get it here: https://spacedock.info/mod/2506/Next Star Industries

29 minutes ago, Next_Star_Industries said:

My mod adds a lifespan to Kerbals get it here: https://spacedock.info/mod/2506/Next Star Industries

Combined with DeepFreeze and one of the life support mods, this could be a great game challenge.
